version.description: Siddarth Abraham, Mark Escottee, Akhilesh Kumar and Samson Phillip come together as Solder, a city-based jam band

version.name: Anil Desai
version.description: Comedian and impressionist Anil Desai, also known by his aliases Rajesh – Bollywood Lounge Singer and Candice the Fluffer Girl, brings his act to town. On Combedybox online, Desai has over 25,000 hits for his performance of 52 impressions in 5 minutes. Part improv comedy, part stand up, Desai often riffs off the audience, performing his impressions as names of personalities are called out from the audience

version.name: Christabel & Peter
version.description: The duo will present an evening of pop, rock ’n’ roll and blues. Call 2559-4567 to make reservations.

version.description: DJ Hassan promises to play all the popular rock and retro tunes. 3052-7777 for details.

version.name: The Dimension of the Plane
version.description: An exhibition of “Communication Design in Germany”, hosted by the German Design Council

event.name: The Dimension of the Plane – Communication Design in Germany

version.name: The Dimension of the Plane – Communication Design in Germany
version.description: Browse through 150 recent works by influential German designers at this exhibition of contemporary two-dimensional communication design services from Germany, the oldest of which date back to the early 2000s. Get an overview of the works by renowned German design agencies such as Johannes Erler, Mike Meiré, Joachim Sauter, Erik Spiekmann and Andreas Uebele

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: GML Ananya Cultural Academy presents a special series that will celebrate Devi – the eternal goddess. The two dancers performing, Sheshadri Iyengar and Samyuktha Sharath, will use special kritis, devotional songs, to extol the various aspects of Devi.

version.name: Herbert Erich Lang & Ambi Subramaniam
version.description: A Carnatic recital featuring Subramaniam on violin, V Ramanamurthi on mridangam, Lang, a professor in Carnatic music from Germany, on kanjira and Ganthasala Satya Sai on morsing

version.name: Collage workshop
version.description: Collages are a great way to express your creativity. You can display your work of art at home or gift it to a friend. Learn the basics of making a paper collage in different styles and patterns. Ages 12+.

version.description: The Dutch composer and DJ, who has won acclaim from Tiesto and Armin van Buuren, plays trance and progressive music. Call 98861-22458 for details.

version.name: Johnny Deep
version.description: The underground DJ plays his funk-infused music. Call 99166-95200 for details

version.name: Sunday Groove
version.description: An open stage for the city’s musicians to meet and jam.

version.name: Bulls Unplugged
version.description: Every Monday night, Opus hosts upcoming Bangalore bands, live and unplugged

version.name: Water Station (Neerina Tanna)
version.description: Dir: N Manjunatha. Writer: Ota Shogo. Cast: Hudukata Ranga Thanda. Synopsis Japanese dramaturgist/director Ota Shogo famously said of his experimental work, “There are words here. You just can’t hear them.” The first of his trilogy of plays (it was followed by Earth Station and Wind Station) which deal with man’s interaction of the elements of nature, it centres on a tap which becomes a stop for a stream of travellers to rest. Expressions, gestures, glances and walks fill the space that would normally be occupied by dialogue and narration

version.name: Rizwaan
version.description: Writer/Dir: Abhishek Majumdar. Cast: Indian Ensemble

version.name: Mysooru Mallige
version.description: "Dir: BV Rajaram. Writer: Rajendra Karanth (based on KS Narasimhaswamy’s poems). Cast: Kalagangotri. Synopsis KS Narasimhaswamy’s collection of poetry was first published in 1942, to immediate acclaim. In it the poet created fictional town of Naviluru, and examined at life in rural India before independence, through characters like the bangle seller Balegaara Channaya, is central to the theatrical adaptation. For ticket information contact 94480-69667.

version.name: Shudra Tapaswi
version.description: Dir: Manjunath Badiger. Writer: Kuvempu. Cast: Ninasam, Heggodu. 2hours. Synopsis After his victory over Ravana, Rama returns to Ayodhya and is crowned king. When a child dies, he is advised that it is because dharma isn’t being followed correctly in the kingdom. He soon learns that a member of the Shudra caste, named Shambuka, is performing penance, thus defying the rules of caste system. Rama executes him by beheading. This adaptation also incorporates text from another Kuvempu work, Sri Ramayana Darshanam.

version.name: Othello
version.description: Dir: Jehaan Manekshaw. Writer: William Shakespeare. Cast: Ninasam, Heggodu. 2 hours. Shakespeare’s tale of the Moor ravaged by jealousy, adapted into Kannada by KS Nissar Ahmed.

version.name: Anil Murthy
version.description: A five-day Carnatic music festival as part of the Vijayadashami celebrations conducted by GML Ananya Cultural Academy will begin with a vocal recital featuring Murthy, accompanied by Mysore R Dayakar on violin, B Dhruvaraj on mridangam and S Srishyla on ghatam

version.name: Chitra Lingam
version.description: A Carnatic veena recital by Lingam, accompanied by TS Chandrashekar on mridangam and M Gururaj on morsing

version.name: CN Thyagarajan
version.description: A Carnatic concert led by the flautist, accompanied by JK Sridhar on violin, N Vasudev on mridangam and Dayananda Mohite on ghatam

version.name: Actor Chorus Text
version.description: Applications are invited for a four-day acting workshop by Anna Helena McLean, of Actor Chorus Text, UK. Through playful exercises in music, rhythm and dynamic physicality, up to 20 participants will be introduced to ACT’s theatre training

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: Jyotsna Jagannathan will perform “Angayar Kanni”, a navarasa varnam or histrionic piece that dwells on the nine emotions of Devi, the mother goddess, composed by Lalgudi Jayaraman, as part of her recital

version.name: Peruvian dances
version.description: The performing unit of the Association Puno for Art and Tradition will present five traditional dances that represent the geographical regions of the country: the coast, the highlands, the jungle and the plains

version.name: P Unni Krishnan & Anil Srinivasan
version.description: A Carnatic vocal and piano jugalbandhi

version.name: TM Krishna and Rashid Khan
version.description: A Carnatic and Hindustani vocal jugalbandhi

version.name: Wedding Album
version.description: Dir: Lilette Dubey. Writer: Girish Karnad. Cast: Utkarsh Mazumdar, Neena Kulkarni, Ira Dubey, Suchitra Pillai. Review Wedding Album has all the excitement, feuding and tears that are characteristic of any household planning a wedding. Vidula, the youngest member of the Nadkarni family in small-town Dharwad, is unsure of marrying a man she has only conversed with over the phone and on the internet, but remains optimistic about the match. Her elder sister, still sore about her low-profile wedding many years ago, is shocked to be the object of affection of the adolescent boy next door, while Vidula’s brother tries to avoid a persistent marriage proposal. Wedding Album comments on the role of memory in narration but doesn’t always seem sure about its purpose. There are unnecessary detours, such as a lecture on moral policing and a finale that ties up a sub-plot rather than the main story. But the laughs come fast and easy as the bride’s parents and the maid jump into the fray - Saumya Ancheri

version.name: Drones from the Turbine
version.description: Anand Vijayasimha on vocals and guitar, Aditya Kishore on percussion, Jaydev Umesh and Nithin Sadhu on guitars, Pranav K on bass and Ashish Sharma on the visual mixer form the psychedelic rock band, Drones from the Turbine. For entry charges contact the venue

version.name: Parvaaz
version.description: Kashif Iqbal on vocals and guitar, Khalid Ahamed on vocals, Neil Simon on bass, Adarsh Deokota on guitar and Somarshi Bhattacharya on drums are a Sufi rock band. For entry charges contact the venue

version.name: Book release
version.description: Bangalore-based writer Monideepa Sahu will lead you through the adventures of Rishabh the rat and Shashee the spider. In her new book, Riddle of the Seventh Stone, you read the exploits of these two characters as they rummage through Venkat Thata’s herb shop in the heart of Bangalore and transform into human children and figure it is hard to be children afterall. Sahu will read from her novel, answer questions and there are games to be played.

version.name: Transmigrations
version.description: A show of photographs by Karen Knorr. For details call Megha at 99864-70678

version.name: International Career Guidance Conference
version.description: Culture is on the agenda for the IAEVG-Jiva Conference of counsellors from around the world. Organised by the Promise Foundation with the objective of bringing together the wisdom of different cultures in counselling, the three-day programme includes thematic sessions and several keynotes lectures. Founder of the Aseema Trust, an organisation that attempts to incorporate traditional performing arts in education guided by Gandhian thought, VR Devika speaks on Gandhi’s approach to work. Gideon Arulmani and Kamini Ramachandran present on storytelling as a mode of counselling. Frederick Leong, a professor of psychology from Michigan State University speaks on new models of counselling. Also on the agenda is a symposium on traditional occupations in the modern world. An exhibition titled Hunters to Hotels by archaeologist Shanti Pappu documents the history of work

version.name: From Soil to Seed
version.description: Take control of your food by learning integrated farming techniques practiced by Annadana, a soil and seed saving network. Learn soil regeneration techniques, seed showing techniques as well as seed saving.To register call Pavitra Prasan on 96326-80564

version.name: Bharatanatyam
version.description: Kumar, a student B Bhanumathi and Sheela Chandrashekar will perform pieces from the traditional margam of bharatanatyam

version.name: Talk on Open Education Online
version.description: Online The next biggest thing after open source software is open source content. There are valuable open content resources for higher education online, according to Phillipp Schmidt, co-founder of the Peer-to-peer University, an online initiative focused on delivering free college-level courses online. With higher education systems around the world becoming increasingly inaccessible to large sections of the population due to prohibitive costs and limited seats, an online university with free courses could be the way forward. Schmidt speaks about the future of higher education, open content, and the role of the Internet in setting knowledge free

version.name: Kathak
version.description: STEM Dance Kampni will present excerpts from their recent choreographic works. The first, Sanjog, fuses motifs of kathak and flamenco in its choreography and music design. The second, Vajra, will explore the tangible forms of divinity using the shape of a diamond as a movement cue
